Auxio needs permission to read your music library
A simple, rational music player for android.
Monitoring your music library for changes…
Donate to the project to get your name added here!
Control how music and images are loaded
Manage where music should be loaded from
Music will not be loaded from the folders you add.
Music will only be loaded from the folders you add.
Ignore audio files that are not music, such as podcasts
Always start playing when a headset is connected (may not work on all devices)
Only show artists that are directly credited on an album (works best on well-tagged libraries)
Correctly sort names that begin with numbers or words like \"the\" (works best with english-language music)
Keep shuffle on when playing a new song
Change visibility and order of library tabs
Reload the music library whenever it changes (requires persistent notification)
The pre-amp is applied to the existing adjustment during playback
Warning: Changing the pre-amp to a high positive value may result in peaking on some audio tracks.
Reload the music library, using cached tags when possible
Remain playing/paused when skipping or editing queue
Prefer album if one is playing
Clear the tag cache and fully reload the music library (slower, but more complete)
Restore the previously saved playback state (if any)
Rewind before skipping to the previous song
Enable rounded corners on additional UI elements (requires album covers to be rounded)
Save the current playback state now
Configure characters that denote multiple tag values
Warning: Using this setting may result in some tags being incorrectly interpreted as having multiple values. You can resolve this by prefixing unwanted separator characters with a backslash (\\).
Crop all album covers to a 1:1 aspect ratio
Change the theme and colors of the app
Clear the previously saved playback state (if any)
